title: Undistort returning black images for one of the cameras for 3D project calibration
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version** OS: Centos Linux 7 DeepLabCut Version: 2.1.8.2 Anaconda env used: yes **Describe the problem** Hello, I'm having some difficulties with the 3d calibration for two cameras. I input about 50 pairs of checkboard images and after iterating I get about 20 pairs that look good with correct corner detection. Here is a .zip of those images. However, after I run `deeplabcut.calibrate_cameras(config_path, cbrow=8, cbcol=6, calibrate=False, alpha=0.9)`, `deeplabcut.calibrate_cameras(config_path, cbrow=8, cbcol=6, calibrate=True, alpha=0.9)`, and then `deeplabcut.check_undistortion(config_path, cbrow=8, cbcol=6)`. Half of the images in the undistort folder are black, and the undistort looks incorrect. (.zip attached). [undistortion.zip](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/6051844/undistortion.zip) [corners.zip](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/6051846/corners.zip) [calibration_images.zip](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/files/6051848/calibration_images.zip) If i continue onwards and run `deeplabcut.triangulate(config_path, '/home/jwang91/DeepLabCut/3dvideos', filterpredictions=False, videotype="mp4")`, the following error is returned.
Code output

--------------------------------------------------------------------------- IndexError Traceback (most recent call last) in ----> 1 deeplabcut.triangulate(config_path, '/home/jwang91/DeepLabCut/3dvideos', filterpredictions=False, videotype="mp4") ~/.conda/envs/deeplabcut/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_3d/triangulation.py in triangulate(config, video_path, videotype, filterpredictions, filtertype, gputouse, destfolder, save_as_csv) 212 #undistort points for this pair 213 print("Undistorting...") --> 214 dataFrame_camera1_undistort,dataFrame_camera2_undistort,stereomatrix,path_stereo_file = undistort_points(config,dataname,str(cam_names[0]+'-'+cam_names[1]),destfolder) 215 if len(dataFrame_camera1_undistort) != len(dataFrame_camera2_undistort): 216 import warnings ~/.conda/envs/deeplabcut/lib/python3.6/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_3d/triangulation.py in undistort_points(config, dataframe, camera_pair, destfolder) 314 if True: 315 # Create an empty dataFrame to store the undistorted 2d coordinates and likelihood --> 316 dataframe_cam1 = pd.read_hdf(dataframe[0]) 317 dataframe_cam2 = pd.read_hdf(dataframe[1]) 318 scorer_cam1 = dataframe_cam1.columns.get_level_values(0)[0] IndexError: list index out of range

**How to Reproduce the problem** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1.import dlc 2.create 3d project 3.move images into calibration_images folder 4.run calibrate_cameras(calibrate=False) 5.run calibrate_cameras(calibrate=True) 6.run check_undistort 7.see incorrect undistort folder I would greatly appreciate any help or insight someone could provide for this! Thank you.
